xml.title: List of Important People, Places, and Things mentioned in Paul Siple's Letter to Mr. Behrend

person.name: Ernst Behrend
person.desc: President of the Hammermill Paper Company. Lent a sextant to Paul Siple for use in his Antarctic expedition.

person.name: Paul Siple
person.desc: American Antarctic explorer. Participated in all 5 expeditions conducted by Admiral Byrd.

person.name: Richard Byrd
person.desc: American naval officer and Antarctic explorer. Admiral Byrd conducted 5 Antarctic expeditions between 1928 and 1956.

person.name: Alton Wade
person.desc: Franklin Alton Wade was an American geologist who accompanied Admiral Richard Byrd on two Antarctic expeditions.

person.name: Olin Stancliff
person.desc: Part of Admiral Byrd's Antarctic sledging party. Olin Stancliff primarily served as a dog driver. Little other information is available.

person.name: Stevenson Corey
person.desc: Dog driver serving on Admiral Byrd's Anrarctic sledging party.

place.name: Marie Byrd Land
place.desc: Unclaimed region of Antarctica. Named after the wife of Admiral Richard E. Byrd.

place.name: Little America
place.desc: A series of bases established in Antarctica by Admiral Byrd.

place.name: Mt. Raymond Fosdick
place.desc: A mountain located in the Fosdick Mountain Range in Marie Byrd Land.

place.name: Edsel Ford Mountain Range
place.desc: The mountain range containing Mt Raymond Fosdick

thing.name: Sextant
thing.desc: An instrument used in celestial navigation used to measure the distance between two visible objects.
